comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

When I'm scrolling comboboxes, the box will be black sometimes. Also is the whole Window sometimes "faulty". See Screenshot

Reproducible: Sometimes

Steps to Reproduce:
sorry, not reproduceable :-( but it's very often
Actual Results:  
minimize and maximize the window will help for a short time
comments.creator: adrianbedrunka@gmail.com

comments.text:
Is your Issue reproducible in Safe-Mode?
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

If yes, please post the Content of the Graphics Section you can get via "about:support" after you restarted in normal Mode.
comments.raw_text:
Is your Issue reproducible in Safe-Mode?
https://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/Safe+Mode

If yes, please post the Content of the Graphics Section you can get via "about:support" after you restarted in normal Mode.
Updating your system's graphics drivers may help this problem http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/how-do-i-upgrade-my-graphics-drivers
comments.creator: kbrosnan@mozilla.com
comments.author: kbrosnan@mozilla.com
comments.text: Updating your system's graphics drivers may help this problem http://support.mozilla.com/en-US/kb/how-do-i-upgrade-my-graphics-drivers

comments.author: xtc4uall@gmail.com
comments.creator: xtc4uall@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: I'd go the Graphics Driver Update Path first and then check the Extensions.

comments.creator: kbrosnan@mozilla.com
comments.text: Safe mode disables Firefox's GPU acceleration. Your driver is several months out of date. Try the latest version from http://support.amd.com/us/gpudownload/windows/Pages/radeonaiw_vista64.aspx
